Photo / Paul Taylor

Behind the scenes at Tūrangawaewae Marae: Showcasing the ‘dungeon and kitchen’ kaimahi https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/behind-the-scenes-at-turangawaewae-marae-showcasing-the-dungeon-and-kitchen-kaimahi/LUF4BWC4Y5HPDAFCUPA7JV3TY4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/behind-the-scenes-at-turangawaewae-marae-showcasing-the-dungeon-and-kitchen-kaimahi/LUF4BWC4Y5HPDAFCUPA7JV3TY4/ Maryana Garcia'All of it’s enjoyable. The people here are all working for the same cause.' Tue, 03 Sep 2024 17:30:00 +0000 With the passing of the Māori King Tūheitia, the kitchen at ūrangawaewae Marae in Ngāruawāhia, is a hive of action, steam, cooking and serving for the thousands who have turned out to pay their respects. Raymond Riri is the co-'Dungeon Master' sorting out the meat stocks for the kitchen. Photo / Mike Scott

Gisborne woman’s battle with malaria in South Sudan inspires groundbreaking fever research https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/09/04/gisborne-womans-battle-with-malaria-in-south-sudan-inspires-groundwriting-fever-research/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/09/04/gisborne-womans-battle-with-malaria-in-south-sudan-inspires-groundwriting-fever-research/ Wynsley Wrigley'Fever might be our body's way of launching an attack against infection.': researcher Tue, 03 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Malaghan Institute PHD student Rosemary Jackson, formerly of Gisborne, is conducting research on the impact of fever on the immune system.
